meanings.definition: Having many crags or rugged features.
meanings.sent1: The mountain was the craggiest I had ever seen, with sharp rocks jutting out everywhere.
meanings.sent2: The craggiest cliffs overlooked the turbulent sea below.
meanings.sent3: The craggiest path up the hill made the hikers feel like they were climbing a giant's staircase.
meanings.sent4: Her craggiest expression softened when she saw the puppy approaching.
meanings.sent5: The craggiest peaks of the range were shrouded in mist, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: Among all the rocky terrains we explored, that was the craggiest one we encountered.
meanings.sent2: The craggiest parts of the landscape provided a challenging but rewarding climb.
meanings.sent3: The craggiest rock formation looked like a giant's broken tooth sticking out of the ground.
meanings.sent4: Her voice echoed off the craggiest cliffs, carrying her words far and wide.
meanings.sent5: The craggiest edges of the canyon caught the last rays of the setting sun, glowing like embers.
